contextId.information: This is describing something that has not happened and should not happen. AT: "would proclaim" or "were to proclaim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

Paul is speaking of a situation that did not exist to emphasize that the inheritance came only by means of the promise. AT: "the inheritance comes to us by means of the promise, because we could not keep the demands of God's law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: For if the inheritance comes by the law, then it no longer comes by promise

contextId.information: Paul is describing a situation that does not exist to emphasize that people persecute him because he is preaching that God forgives people because of Jesus' work on the cross. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: In that case the stumbling block of the cross has been removed
